question: Sample Registration System, True is:-
exp: Sample Registration System;- SRS most accurate as it is the only dual record data collection system. Here we measure IMR, MMR, U-5. MR, NMR, Growth rate It is conducted once every 6 months. NFHS:- Conducted by IIPS, Mumbai It has completed 4 rounds Once undeaken every 5 - 6 years DLHS:- This is used for MCH indicators Focuses routine assessment of regular immunization coverage levels district wise in India Undeaken once every 4-5 years Round completed -4 rounds.
opa: It is the only dual record data collection system
opd: It mandates bih, death and marriage registration

question: According to Census 2011, Child sex ratio is:-
exp: According to Census 2011, Child sex ratio is 919. Child Sex ratio = x 1000. Highest in Mizoram. Lowest in Haryana. CSR-919 Adult sex ratio- 943/1000 males Highest - Kerala Lowest- Daman and diu(U. T), haryana(state)

question: At what point in time is the population assessed for calculation of Crude death rate?
exp: For calculation of crude death rate, mid-year population is assesed. Population count as on 1st July of an year is considered as Mid Year Population of that year. Crude bih rate (CBR): Annual number of live bihs per 1000 mid-year population Crude death rate (CDR): Annual number of deaths per 1000 mid-year population 1st july also celebrated as doctor's day Findings of SRS Bulletin: 1. Crude Bih Rate (CBR): 20. 2 per 1000 mid-year population 2. Crude Death Rate (CDR): 6. 3 per 1000 mid-year population

question: Figure is showing Population pyramid. Select inappropriate statement regarding it:-
exp: Developing Developed countries Shape (Tells feility pattern) - Upright Triangle - Broad base, narrow top as more % of population in child age & less % in geriatric age. - Spindle shape with a bulge in middle - Max population is in the middle years of life i. e. economically productive age group. Span (indicates life expectancy) It means height. It is less here. It is taller or higher. Symmetry - Asymmetric - Cause is sex selective aboions, female foeticide etc. - Symmetrical - It indicates sex ratio of country
opa: It is double histogram by nature
opc: Broad base and narrow top as more % of population in child age

question: In a city of 10000, Males: Females are 1: 1. Sex ratio is:-
exp: Sex Ratio = Females/ Males X 1000 1x/1x X1000 = 1000

question: Bih and death registration must be done within:-
exp: According to 'The registration of bihs & Deaths act 1969' both the bihs and deaths are to be registered with 21 days each. Marriages within 30 days/ 60 days/ 90 days. Child born to NRI couple abroad, bih registration is done within 60days of arrival. Bih registration is responsibility of hospital.

question: If the annual growth rate of population is 1. 5-2% then growth of population is rated as:-
exp: Relation between growth rate and population Rating Annual Rate of Growth % Number of years required for population to double in size Stationarypopulation Slow growth Moderate growth Rapid growth Very rapid growth "Explosive" growth -------"-------- -------"-------- -------"-------- No growth Less than 0. 5 0. 5 to 1. 0 1. 0 to 1. 5 1. 5 to 2. 0 2. 0 to 2. 5 2. 5 to 3. 0 3. 0 to 3. 5 3. 5 to 4. 0 Nil More than 139 139-70 70-47 47-35 35-28 28-23 23-20 20-18

question: 'Mid-year population' is not the denominator of which moality rate?
exp: In propoional moality rate, the denominator is the total number of deaths due to all causes

question: National Family Health Survey has successfully completed:-
exp: National Family Health Survey (NFHS) is conducted once in every 5-6 years by International institute of population sciences (IIPS), Mumbai. 1st conducted in 1992-93, 2nd 1998-99, 3rd 2005-06, 4th 2015-16. Four rounds of National Family Health Survey have been conducted so far.

question: A community has total population 10000. Children ranging 0-6 years are 2000. Literate persons among > 7 years of are 4000. What is Effective literacy rate?
exp: Effective literacy rate (ELR) = No. of literates / Total population > 7 years age X 100 In the given question, Total population = 10000, Population 0-6 years age = 2000 So population > 7 years age = 10000-2000 = 8000 So ELR = 4000/8000 X 100 = 50%

question: The most cost-effective family planning method is-
exp: Vasectomy and IUD are one of the most cost-effective methods of contraception. Most impoant demographic feility indicator is -NRR. To achieve NRR-1, CPR should be >60%, ideal contraception is sterilization.
